item.text: The next few questions help measure the level that pain interferes in daily activities.

code.display: How much did pain interfere with your day to day activities?

item.text: How much did pain interfere with your day to day activities?

These questions were developed by scientists at the National Institutes of Health (NIH). They are part of the NIH Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) Computer Adaptive Test (CAT). This qiestion is part of  PROMIS Pain Interference score.

code.display: How much did pain interfere with work around the home?

item.text: How much did pain interfere with work around the home?

These questions were developed by scientists at the National Institutes of Health (NIH). They are part of the NIH Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) Computer Adaptive Test (CAT). This qiestion is part of  PROMIS Pain Interference score.

code.display: How much did pain interfere with your ability to participate in social activities?

item.text: How much did pain interfere with your ability to participate in social activities?

These questions were developed by scientists at the National Institutes of Health (NIH). They are part of the NIH Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) Computer Adaptive Test (CAT). This qiestion is part of  PROMIS Pain Interference score.

code.display: How much did pain interfere with your household chores?

item.text: How much did pain interfere with your household chores?

These questions were developed by scientists at the National Institutes of Health (NIH). They are part of the NIH Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) Computer Adaptive Test (CAT). This qiestion is part of  PROMIS Pain Interference score.
PROMIS INTERFERENCE Score

The following five sections deal with pain. Please read each question and answer as well as you can. There is no right or wrong answer, only what is true for you. The next few questions help measure the level of your physical activity.

code.display: Are you able to go for a walk of at least 15 minutes?

item.text: Are you able to go for a walk of at least 15 minutes?

These questions were developed by scientists at the National Institutes of Health (NIH). They are part of the NIH Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) Computer Adaptive Test (CAT). This qiestion is part of  PROMIS Physical Function score.

code.display: Are you able to go up and down stairs at a normal pace?

item.text: Are you able to go up and down stairs at a normal pace?

These questions were developed by scientists at the National Institutes of Health (NIH). They are part of the NIH Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) Computer Adaptive Test (CAT). This qiestion is part of  PROMIS Physical Function score.

code.display: Are you able to do chores such as vacuuming or yard work?

item.text: Are you able to do chores such as vacuuming or yard work?

These questions were developed by scientists at the National Institutes of Health (NIH). They are part of the NIH Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) Computer Adaptive Test (CAT). This qiestion is part of  PROMIS Physical Function score.

code.display: Are you able to run errands and shop?

item.text: Are you able to run errands and shop?

These questions were developed by scientists at the National Institutes of Health (NIH). They are part of the NIH Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) Computer Adaptive Test (CAT). This qiestion is part of  PROMIS Physical Function score.
PROMIS PHYSICAL ACTIVITY Score

This questionnaire has been designed to give us information as to how your back pain is affecting your ability to manage in everyday life. It takes about 3 minutes. Please answer by checking ONE box in each section for the statement which best applies to you. We realize you may consider that two or more statements in any one section apply, but please just mark the box that indicates the statement which most clearly describes your problem.

code.display: How would you rate your low-back pain on average?

item.text: How would you rate your low-back pain on average?

This question is part of the Oswestry Disability Questionnaire. It measures how much your back pain is affecting your ability to manage in everyday life. Please answer by checking ONE box for the statement which best applies to you. We realize you may consider that two or more statements may apply, but please just mark the box that indicates the statement which most clearly describes your problem.
Pain Intensity

valueCoding.display: I have no pain at the moment.
The pain is very mild at the moment.
The pain is moderate at the moment.
The pain is fairly severe at the moment.
The pain is very severe at the moment.
The pain is the worst imaginable at the moment.

item.text: This question is part of the Oswestry Disability Questionnaire. It measures how much your back pain is affecting your ability to manage in everyday life. Please answer by checking ONE box for the statement which best applies to you. We realize you may consider that two or more statements may apply, but please just mark the box that indicates the statement which most clearly describes your problem.
Personal Care (washing, dressing, etc.)

valueCoding.display: I can do it without pain.
I can do it but it causes pain.
I need help in most self-care.
I do not get dressed and stay in bed.

item.text: This question is part of the Oswestry Disability Questionnaire. It measures how much your back pain is affecting your ability to manage in everyday life. Please answer by checking ONE box for the statement which best applies to you. We realize you may consider that two or more statements may apply, but please just mark the box that indicates the statement which most clearly describes your problem.
Lifting

valueCoding.display: I can lift heavy weights without pain.
I can lift heavy weights with pain.
I can lift heavy weights if conveniently positioned
I can lift very light weights.
I cannot lift or carry anything at all.

item.text: This question is part of the Oswestry Disability Questionnaire. It measures how much your back pain is affecting your ability to manage in everyday life. Please answer by checking ONE box for the statement which best applies to you. We realize you may consider that two or more statements may apply, but please just mark the box that indicates the statement which most clearly describes your problem.
Walking

valueCoding.display: Pain does not prevent me from walking any distance.
Pain prevents me from walking more than 1 mile.
Pain prevents me from walking more than 1/2 mile.
Pain prevents me from walking more than 100 yards.
I can only walk using a stick or crutches.
I am in bed most of the time.

item.text: This question is part of the Oswestry Disability Questionnaire. It measures how much your back pain is affecting your ability to manage in everyday life. Please answer by checking ONE box for the statement which best applies to you. We realize you may consider that two or more statements may apply, but please just mark the box that indicates the statement which most clearly describes your problem.
Sitting

valueCoding.display: I can sit in any chair as long as I like.
I can only sit in my favorite chair as long as I like.
Pain prevents me from sitting more than one hour.
Pain prevents me from sitting more than 30 minutes.
Pain prevents me from sitting more than 10 minutes.
Pain prevents me from sitting at all.

item.text: This question is part of the Oswestry Disability Questionnaire. It measures how much your back pain is affecting your ability to manage in everyday life. Please answer by checking ONE box for the statement which best applies to you. We realize you may consider that two or more statements may apply, but please just mark the box that indicates the statement which most clearly describes your problem.
Standing

valueCoding.display: I can stand as long as I want without pain.
I can stand as long as I want but it causes pain.
Pain prevents me from standing more than 1 hour.
Pain prevents me from standing more than 30 minutes.
Pain prevents me from standing more than 10 minutes.
Pain prevents me from standing at all.

item.text: This question is part of the Oswestry Disability Questionnaire. It measures how much your back pain is affecting your ability to manage in everyday life. Please answer by checking ONE box for the statement which best applies to you. We realize you may consider that two or more statements may apply, but please just mark the box that indicates the statement which most clearly describes your problem.
Sleeping

valueCoding.display: My sleep is never disturbed by pain.
My sleep is occasionally disturbed by pain.
Because of pain I have less than 6 hours sleep.
Because of pain I have less than 4 hours sleep.
Because of pain I have less than 2 hours sleep.
Pain prevents me from sleeping at all.

item.text: This question is part of the Oswestry Disability Questionnaire. It measures how much your back pain is affecting your ability to manage in everyday life. Please answer by checking ONE box for the statement which best applies to you. We realize you may consider that two or more statements may apply, but please just mark the box that indicates the statement which most clearly describes your problem.
Sex Life (if applicable)

valueCoding.display: My sex life is normal and causes no extra pain.
My sex life is normal but causes some extra pain.
My sex life is nearly normal but is very painful.
My sex life is severely restricted by pain.
My sex life is nearly absent because of pain.
Pain prevents any sex life at all.

item.text: This question is part of the Oswestry Disability Questionnaire. It measures how much your back pain is affecting your ability to manage in everyday life. Please answer by checking ONE box for the statement which best applies to you. We realize you may consider that two or more statements may apply, but please just mark the box that indicates the statement which most clearly describes your problem.
Social Life

valueCoding.display: My social life is normal and gives me no extra pain.
My social life is normal but increases the degree of pain.
Pain limits my more energetic interests, e.g., sport.
Pain has restricted my social life and I do not go out as often.
Pain has restricted my social life to my home.
I have no social life because of pain.

item.text: This question is part of the Oswestry Disability Questionnaire. It measures how much your back pain is affecting your ability to manage in everyday life. Please answer by checking ONE box for the statement which best applies to you. We realize you may consider that two or more statements may apply, but please just mark the box that indicates the statement which most clearly describes your problem.
Traveling

valueCoding.display: I can travel anywhere without pain.
I can travel anywhere but it gives me extra pain.
Pain is bad but I manage journeys over 2 hours.
Pain is bad but I manage journeys less than 1 hour.
Pain restricts me to short necessary journeys under 30 minutes.
Pain prevents me from traveling except to receive treatment.

item.text: This question is part of the Oswestry Disability Questionnaire. It measures how much your back pain is affecting your ability to manage in everyday life. Please answer by checking ONE box for the statement which best applies to you. We realize you may consider that two or more statements may apply, but please just mark the box that indicates the statement which most clearly describes your problem.

valueExpression.name: any_questions_answered
valueExpression.expression: %bs1_value.exists() or %bs2_value.exists() or %bs3_value.exists() or %bs4_value.exists() or %bs5_value.exists() or %bs6_value.exists() or %bs7_value.exists() or %bs8_value.exists() or %bs9_value.exists() or %bs10_value.exists() or %bs11_value.exists()

iif(%any_questions_answered, iif(%bs1_value.exists(), %bs1_value, 0) + iif(%bs2_value.exists(), %bs2_value, 0) + iif(%bs3_value.exists(), %bs3_value, 0) + iif(%bs4_value.exists(), %bs4_value, 0) + iif(%bs5_value.exists(), %bs5_value, 0) + iif(%bs6_value.exists(), %bs6_value, 0) + iif(%bs7_value.exists(), %bs7_value, 0) + iif(%bs8_value.exists(), %bs8_value, 0) + iif(%bs9_value.exists(), %bs9_value, 0) + iif(%bs10_value.exists(), %bs10_value, 0) + iif(%bs11_value.exists(), %bs11_value, 0), {})

item.text: Back Pain Severity Score
The next eight questions help evaluate results of treatment.

code.display: Are you currently using opioid pain killers? (prescription medications such as Vicodin, Lortab, Norco, hydrocodone, codeine, Tylenol #3 or #4, Fentanyl, Duragesic, MS Contin, Percocet, Tylox, OxyContin, oxycodone, methadone, tramadol, Ultram, Dilaudi

item.text: Are you currently using opioid pain killers? (prescription medications such as Vicodin, Lortab, Norco, hydrocodone, codeine, Tylenol #3 or #4, Fentanyl, Duragesic, MS Contin, Percocet, Tylox, OxyContin, oxycodone, methadone, tramadol, Ultram, Dilaudi
This question helps measure results of back pain treatment.

code.display: Have you had to go to an Emergency Room for any reason?

item.text: Have you had to go to an Emergency Room for any reason?
This question helps measure results of back pain treatment.

code.display: Have you had a low-back operation?

item.text: Have you had a low-back operation?
This question helps measure results of back pain treatment.

code.display: Have you had low back injection (such as epidural steroid injection, facet injection)?

item.text: Have you had low back injection (such as epidural steroid injection, facet injection)?
This question helps measure results of back pain treatment.
Have you had physical therapy?

valueCoding.display: Yes, more than one series of treatments

item.text: This question helps measure results of back pain treatment.

code.display: Have you had psychological counseling for pain coping skills, such as cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT)?

item.text: Have you had psychological counseling for pain coping skills, such as cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT)?
This question helps measure results of back pain treatment.

code.display: Have you had to take time off work?

item.text: Have you had to take time off work?
This question helps measure results of back pain treatment.
Have you applied for disability?

valueCoding.display: Yes, both workers comp and social security

item.text: This question helps measure results of back pain treatment.

valueExpression.name: any_questions_answered
valueExpression.expression: %so1_value.exists() or %so2_value.exists() or %so3_value.exists() or %so4_value.exists() or %so5_value.exists() or %so6_value.exists() or %so7_value.exists() or %so8_value.exists()

iif(%any_questions_answered, iif(%so1_value.exists(), %so1_value, 0) + iif(%so2_value.exists(), %so2_value, 0) + iif(%so3_value.exists(), %so3_value, 0) + iif(%so4_value.exists(), %so4_value, 0) + iif(%so5_value.exists(), %so5_value, 0) + iif(%so6_value.exists(), %so6_value, 0) + iif(%so7_value.exists(), %so7_value, 0) + iif(%so8_value.exists(), %so8_value, 0), {})
